title: Wye Valley Autumn Trail
tagline: The best autumn colours in Wales
suitableFor: Individuals, couples, or small groups who enjoy gentle walks and scenic photography, with a moderate level of fitness.
notSuitableFor: Those with significant mobility issues, or anyone seeking challenging, high-adrenaline activities.

stops.title: Symonds Yat Rock Walk
stops.description: Enjoy panoramic views of the Wye Valley's autumn foliage from Symonds Yat Rock, followed by a circular walk through the surrounding forest.

wetAlt.title: Clearwell Caves
wetAlt.description: Explore the fascinating underground world of Clearwell Caves, a natural cave system mined for iron ore.

budgetAlt.title: Biblins Adventure Playground
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy some time at this fantastic free adventure playground, located close to the Biblins suspension bridge over the Wye.

stops.title: The Saracen's Head Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub with riverside views, serving classic pub fare.

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Yat Rock viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own picnic with stunning views.

stops.title: Canoe Hire from Wyedean Canoe & Adventure Centre
stops.description: Hire a canoe and paddle down the River Wye, enjoying the scenery from a different perspective.

wetAlt.title: Tintern Abbey Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the atmospheric ruins of Tintern Abbey, a Cistercian monastery dating back to the 12th century.

budgetAlt.title: River Wye Walk along the riverside path
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a walk along the River Wye, taking in the views.

stops.title: The Wild Hare, Tintern
stops.description: Boutique guesthouse in Tintern, ideal for a relaxing evening after a day of activities.

stops.title: Offa's Dyke Path Walk (Section near Redbrook)
stops.description: Hike a section of the historic Offa's Dyke Path, enjoying views across the Wye Valley and the Welsh border.

wetAlt.title: Raglan Castle Visit
wetAlt.description: Explore the impressive ruins of Raglan Castle, a late medieval fortress.

budgetAlt.title: Explore the village of Redbrook
budgetAlt.description: Take a stroll around the historic village of Redbrook, by the River Wye.

stops.title: The George Inn, Redbrook
stops.description: A traditional village pub with a cozy atmosphere and good food.

budgetAlt.title: Picnic lunch at Offa's Dyke
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your packed lunch whilst enjoying the views from Offa's Dyke.

stops.title: Puzzlewood
stops.description: Explore the ancient woodland of Puzzlewood, known for its unique rock formations and enchanting atmosphere.

wetAlt.title: Dean Heritage Centre
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history and heritage of the Forest of Dean at the Dean Heritage Centre.

budgetAlt.title: Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail
budgetAlt.description: Visit this wonderful outdoor free sculpture trail.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: October and November can be wet and windy. Pack waterproofs and layers. Check the weather forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy on weekends, especially around popular attractions like Symonds Yat. Arrive early to secure parking.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Canoe hire and certain accommodations require advance booking, especially during peak season.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: A reasonable level of fitness is required for the walking sections, though the terrain is generally easy. Canoe requires some upper body strength.
